H0.text: when did the word of wisdom become mandatory. January 1833

H1.text: when did the word of wisdom become mandatory. August 1835

H2.text: when did the word of wisdom become mandatory. April 1842

H3.text: when did the word of wisdom become mandatory. February 1834

A4.text: In February 1834, Joseph Smith proposed a resolution before the high council of the church that stated, 'No official member in this Church is worthy to hold an office after having the word of wisdom properly taught him; and he, the official member, neglecting to comply with and obey it.'

A5.text: In 1921, LDS Church president Heber J. Grant finally made adherence to the Word of Wisdom a prerequisite for temple admission.
